intro: Asterochlaena hieronymi var. pseudoapiculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, often with a central yellow or green spot. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
